title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 09 December 2016 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <martinus\_\_> Hi, where can I find the documentation for com.xpn.xwiki.util.Util; ?  
10:15 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: you can look at oldcore javadoc  
10:21 <tmortagne> http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/service/local/repositories/releases/archive/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-oldcore/8.4.2/xwiki-platform-oldcore-8.4.2-javadoc.jar/!/index.html  
10:37 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <martinus\_\_> thanks tmortagne  
11:00 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <msmeria1> has quit  
11:11 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, on our 6.4.4 instance, the admintools application make use of com.xpn.xwiki.util.Util for Util.getFileContent(), but I can't find  this method in http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/service/local/repositories/releases/archive/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-oldcore/8.4.2/xwiki-platform-oldcore-8.4.2-javadoc.jar/!/index.html . Or maybe there is a better way to do this ? (ie, to read a file from the local filesystem)  
11:11 <martinus\_\_> more exactly in http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/service/local/repositories/releases/archive/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-oldcore/8.4.2/xwiki-platform-oldcore-8.4.2-javadoc.jar/!/com/xpn/xwiki/util/Util.html  
11:19 <evalica> has quit  
11:22 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: change the version in the URL  
11:22 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <tmortagne> to get the 6.4.4 one  
11:23 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, of course I tried it but it seems it's not there : http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/service/local/repositories/releases/archive/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-oldcore/6.4.4/xwiki-platform-oldcore-6.4.4-javadoc.jar/!/com/xpn/xwiki/util/Util.html  
11:23 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, but, I found it here : http://www.docjar.com/docs/api/com/xpn/xwiki/util/Util.html  
11:23 <tmortagne> the fact that a method does not exist in the javadoc usually means it moved to legacy  
11:23 <vmassol> has quit  
11:24 <tmortagne> i.e. it's injected at build time and not really localed in the actual java class anymore  
11:24 <tmortagne> in other words, bad admin tool, bad  
11:24 <martinus\_\_> hm hmm  
11:27 <tmortagne> now I'm suprised admin tool use a java side method, it's really not designed for scripting  
11:27 <tmortagne> right now a Java code would use commons-io FileUtils instead  
11:28 <martinus\_\_> commons-io, that's what I am looking for I think  
11:28 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne,  I dig into this (opening a file) because I need to attach an existing PDF file from the local filesystem to an email.  
11:28 <tmortagne> if you want the feature provided by Utils#getFileContent and much more then yes you should definitely use commons-io  
11:32 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, is it https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-io/ ?

13:17 <martinus\_\_> the file being on the local filesystem (not xwiki)

14:53 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: you can look at https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-invoices/blob/master/src/main/resources/InvoicesCode/ServiceInitializerListener.xml#L735 for inspiration on how to send a mail in Groovy  
14:53 <tmortagne> but it depends on your version of XWiki  
14:57 <tmortagne> mailsender script service might require 7.4.x to be fully stable  
14:57 <tmortagne> you have the documentation on extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Mail+Sender+API
